intro: Verbascum tagadirtense, commonly known as the Tagadirt mullein, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, showy yellow flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils at high elevations. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in dense, velvety hair, which helps reduce water loss. Verbascum tagadirtense is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
